What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: None
0hrs
none
N/A

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed the seminars! Great variety of speakers and topics presented this semester!!
Interesting talks!

I believe we could benefit from greater professional development sessions with our speakers. In addition, I believe recruiting people from other fields, in addition to academia, would provide much needed variety.
The presentations this semester were excellent.
great lectures!
Some interesting lectures, but would love to see more diversity in presenters and their backgrounds/research topics.
Good Food!
Good seminar. Would like more variety in the types of speakers we get ie. not just researchers or academics; practitioners and other individuals demonstrating the diversity within public health

I liked that it was combined with SBS so that it wasn't every week. I really enjoyed the speaker who talked about lead time bias - felt that they were very relevant given our epidemiology II class. Some of the other speakers were boring...
Good way to learn about a topic other than your own field of study.

Strengths- not too many seminars, and some pretty interesting lectures. Weakness- I'm not really sure what I'm supposed to get out of the course- is it just being exposed to different SBS-based research? I guess it did its job then.
Great selection of speakers.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: John Pachankis  He is great! LOVE HIM!
Instructor: John Pachankis  Love Prof. Pachankis and all the interesting speakers he brings to the program!
Instructor: John Pachankis  WOnderful Wonderful person. Keep up the good work, Dr. Pachankis!
Instructor: John Pachankis  John is great! I loved his enthusiasm about each speaker.
Instructor: John Pachankis  Very good.
Instructor: Shiyi Wang  Good
Instructor: Shiyi Wang  Great organizer.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's required - take it for the food and interesting talks
Good exposure to different fields within academia; very research/academia- heavy
Required seminar with good food and excellent speakers.

Required for CDE students. Lunchtime seminar meetings 5-6 times per semester with a wide range of topics covered. I liked the wide range of topics because it gave me a better sense of all of the potential career directions that one could take after completing the MPH.
Great course. Nice to hear what people in the field are actually up to.
good seminar
Great semester with interesting talks from diverse group of individuals. The timing of this is good, scheduled around noon with lunch provided.
Seminar series with all guest lecturers
A required series of lectures on different research areas. Pretty interesting, even if it is mandatory.
This course is a great way to get exposed to different facets of chronic disease epidemiology. Recommend it.
